Countable Smorgasbord

most things are broken most of the time

opening

~1 min read July 26, 2019

The first project I want to write about is the mathematical theories of deep learning. This is a broad subject which simultaneously has deep roots1 and . One of the fundamental [problems] is that the fundamental structures of deep neural networks are so simple: gradient descent, composition of *very simple nonlinearities *[footnote]: or blessings, if you prefer

  1. Hilbert’s thirteenth problem can actually be viewed as the sort of recursive nonlinearity that is at the heart of neural networks. ↩
